CatDescriptText: I.H. Ross, businessman, Downtown and Walter Lucas, Whitaker, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in the Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, February 4, 1961, pg. 7 with question: "Do you think the names of juveniles who commit felonies, as distinguished from misdemeanors, should be published in the newspapers?"  I.H. Ross's answer reads: "I think so, because it's serious enough to let the people know about it."  Walter Lucas' answer reads: "I don't think so, because it's very hard on the parents."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of I.H. Ross wearing fedora, eyeglasses, light colored shirt, geometrically patterned necktie, and dark jacket, standing in front of Sylvia and Jean's Beauty Shoppe, Smithfield Street, Downtown; Portrait of Walter Lucas wearing moustache, soul patch, and tweed coat, standing in front of Drake-Kapphan Pianos and Western Union, Smithfield Street, Downtown
